May 2, 2026 General Election Information

Election Contact Information: Michelle Lilley, City Secretary 972-617-7262 ext. 102 105 S. Cockrell Road Ovilla, Texas 75154 mlilley@cityofovilla.org

May 2, 2026 - Ovilla City Hall Council Chambers

Mayor Richard Dormier                                                                May 2027 Place 1/Mayor Pro-Tem Kimberly Case                                    May 2026 Place 2, Dean Oberg                                                                     May 2027 Place 3, David Griffin                                                                     May 2026 Place 4, Doug Hunt                                                                        May 2027 Place 5, Sharon Jungman                                                           May 2026

For notices and records of the Ovilla City Council click

Qualifications for the Office of Councilmember

  • Be 18 years of age or older upon the commencement of the term to be filled at the election;
  • Resided continuously in the State of Texas for 12 months, as of the deadline for filing for the office;
  • Resided within the city limits of Ovilla for at least six (6) months preceding the deadline for filing for office;
  • Must be a registered voter in the city by the filing deadline;
  • Not otherwise disqualified from serving on the city council by any other provision of law.

City Council Places 1, 3 and 5 Filing Deadlines:

Filing for a Place on the Ballot - January 14, 2026 - February 13, 2026

The May 2, 2026 General Election will require an application form to be turned into the City Secretary's Office located at 105 S. Cockrell Hill Road Ovilla, Texas 75154. Filing for a place on the ballot is set by state statute and will run from January 14, 2026 through February 13, 2026. Filing documents including the 2026 Candidate Packet will be available for pickup at City Hall. Per the Sec. of State's CSO-3449 Advisory of August 3, 2020, candidate applications may be filed:

  1. In person, with the City Secretary's office at City Hall;
  2. By fax (972-515-3221) or email (mlilley@cityofovilla.org) - A signed, sworn, scanned candidate application. Please be advised that an application must be notarized prior to filing via fax or email.
